alert.note: Alert for Blair; Huntingdon (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 22 at 7:09PM EDT until June 22 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Blair and Huntingdon. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 709 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall of 1 inches is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Altoona, Hollidaysburg, Roaring Spring, Martinsburg, Lakemont, Bellwood, Claysburg, Williamsburg, Duncansville, Dudley, Royer, Canoe Creek State Park, Entriken, Horseshoe Curve, Sinking Valley, Shy Beaver, Ski Gap, East Freedom, Saxton and Broad Top City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
